alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 4:25AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream and creek flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas. Rises in small streams may cause water to overtake roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Dirt roads may be washed out. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 425 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms early this morning produced between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain. This will cause small stream and creek flooding for the next couple hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millinocket, White Cap Mountain, Baxter State Park, southwestern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Frenchtown, Norcross and Grindstone. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
